alert.note: Alert for Mellette; Todd; Tripp (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued April 02 at 2:03PM MDT until April 05 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Blizzard conditions expected Monday afternoon into Wednesday for the Black Hills and western South Dakota... .A strong spring snowstorm will bring very heavy snow to the area, beginning across northeastern Wyoming and southwestern South Dakota Monday morning, spreading northeastward through the day. Winds will increase Monday with widespread 45-65 mph gusts across the area Tuesday afternoon, strongest winds across the western South Dakota plains. The combination of very heavy snow, strong winds, and blowing and drifting snow will result in very difficult travel conditions late Monday through Wednesday. ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM MONDAY TO 7 PM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 15 inches. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. Strongest winds expected late Tuesday morning into Tuesday evening. * WHERE...Mellette County, Todd County and Tripp County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Rosebud Reservation. * WHEN...From 10 PM Monday to 7 PM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means the combination of snow, blowing snow, and strong winds will create dangerous whiteout conditions. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
